title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Secondary Mathematics Learning Complexity Analysis Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Middle school-level mathematical concepts (e.g., fraction operations)
context.additional_context: Real-time interactive workshops conducted in smartphone-based limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish between knowledge complexity (intrinsic interaction elements) and task complexity (extraneous interaction elements) in fraction operations with 80% accuracy.
Learners can classify the complexity of given math problems into three levels (low/medium/high) by applying the Cognitive Load Theory framework.
Learners can propose three strategies to reduce cognitive load encountered during math problem-solving based on analytical results.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
